text:
I am working in startup ecosystem for last 2.5 years, mainly in early stage startups & have very well experience.

But somehow my family still want me to have a government job. Maybe they want stability for me because of our family financial situation. Now they've started saying this on each & every day. It's becoming painful for me.

Is there any way in which I can do a govt job but work in startup environments.  Maybe a particular department which works with startups to help them. Something in the govt's scheme around accelerator program or startup 10000 program or anything like that!

Also what are the exams name?

Please suggest me any way out.

elements.text:
I am working in startup ecosystem for last 2.5 years, mainly in early stage startups & have very well experience.

But somehow my family still want me to have a government job. Maybe they want stability for me because of our family financial situation. Now they've started saying this on each & every day. It's becoming painful for me.

Is there any way in which I can do a govt job but work in startup environments.  Maybe a particular department which works with startups to help them. Something in the govt's scheme around accelerator program or startup 10000 program or anything like that!

Also what are the exams name?

Please suggest me any way out.

text:
> Please suggest me any way out.

Stop listening to your parents. This is your life, not theirs. Make your own choices. Be proud of your choices. Or regret them. I don't care. But don't give control of your life to anyone else.

You will carry this to your offspring(s) and they will to theirs. Break the cycle. Evolve. Become smarter.

elements.text: Please suggest me any way out.

Stop listening to your parents. This is your life, not theirs. Make your own choices. Be proud of your choices. Or regret them. I don't care. But don't give control of your life to anyone else.

You will carry this to your offspring(s) and they will to theirs. Break the cycle. Evolve. Become smarter.

text:
A. Understand what your parents want is the best for you according to them
B. The world has changed and they may not comprehend what best is
C. Make them trust your judgement - if you enjoy working with startups, so be it. Tell them you will do this for x more years before deciding anything.
D. Like the other anon said, become the owner of your choices & consequences. Don’t carry regrets in your heart.

elements.text:

D. Like the other anon said, become the owner of your choices & consequences. Don’t carry regrets in your heart.

text:
I was bit shocked to see the salary survey results yesterday. I am a PMM with 4.5 years of work (2.5 in SaaS) .

My salary is 25 LPA.

According to the survey, my upper ceiling is quite closeby. SaaS marketing doesn’t pay or what? Is becoming an influencer/joining a US based startup/starting up the only solution for big bucks?

elements.text:

My salary is 25 LPA.

text: Wait a minute. I'll be back from depression after reading your message.

elements.text: Wait a minute. I'll be back from depression after reading your message.

text:
I'll go second? 
Where I come from, that's generous. Overworked, verge of breakdowns, all with 13LPA and same experience. But, ofcourse, there's “growth” and laughable stock policy in place to compensate that. 

Now if this isn't a part of the hustle culture, then what is? 
Work for us till you die. You can't? Too bad. You aren't built for this kinda fast paced environment.

Work for us till you die. You can't? Too bad. You aren't built for this kinda fast paced environment.

text:
So till date we have managed to maintain an almost 100% “MQL conversion rate” of prospects who accept a calendar invite to those who pay us, by trying to weed out bad customers who seem like they are evaluating better products in the sales process itself - clearly it worked well :)

Sadly, we’ve run into our second non-paying customer till date. We were looking forward to Tesla joining us as a customer, But it seems better judgement has prevailed, though I was sort of expecting it :disappointed:

#salesmarketingwoes

elements.text:

#salesmarketingwoes

text: When a CEO writes a blog, what do you think he should write about? I can give options but phir woh leading question ho jaayega. the blog is for a company wide update basically.

elements.text: When a CEO writes a blog, what do you think he should write about? I can give options but phir woh leading question ho jaayega. the blog is for a company wide update basically.

text: They should generally share their thoughts, opinions and perspective on the industry that the company operates in. But beyond business they can share their perspective on values that the companies represents.

elements.text: They should generally share their thoughts, opinions and perspective on the industry that the company operates in. But beyond business they can share their perspective on values that the companies represents.

text:
In my understanding, it is best if you enable the CEO/founder actually think like a vlogger/blogger. List down their areas of interest, passion and what they believe in from the core. Then see areas of overlap between the problem the product is trying to solve and what they are truly passionate about (ideally direct/but abstract is also fine to start).

Some examples:

• Intercom founder started talking about customer success/support very early on even before they had a full fledged platform
• Groovehq founder blogged about his journey from 0 to $100k  MRR and beyond
• We all know buffer CEO talking about full transparency, P/L reports/Salary caps etc
• David Cancel talks about scaling, leadership
• and so on
I would go for an overlap between:
• what they are truly truly passionate
• what they have first hand experience in/expertise
• alignment with problem/business model/cultural value (abstract/direct)
I sincerely believe the ideation here should not be delegated to a marketing team/marketer who is not the founder. help the founder brainstorm/shortlist. Give feedback on his tone/tenor/language but let their creativity loose

Hope I didn’t misunderstand your question :slightly_smiling_face: If it is a blog post about funding/hiring etc there are enough formats/playbooks but if you want to build a content/knowledge brand around founder, above observations might help.

elements.text:

Then see areas of overlap between the problem the product is trying to solve and what they are truly passionate about (ideally direct/but abstract is also fine to start).

Some examples:
Intercom founder started talking about customer success/support very early on even before they had a full fledged platform
Groovehq founder blogged about his journey from 0 to $100k  MRR and beyond
We all know buffer CEO talking about full transparency, P/L reports/Salary caps etc
David Cancel talks about scaling, leadership
and so on
I would go for an overlap between:
what they are truly truly passionate
what they have first hand experience in/expertise
alignment with problem/business model/cultural value (abstract/direct)

I sincerely believe the ideation here should not be delegated to a marketing team/marketer who is not the founder. help the founder brainstorm/shortlist. Give feedback on his tone/tenor/language but let their creativity loose

Hope I didn’t misunderstand your question
If it is a blog post about funding/hiring etc there are enough formats/playbooks but if you want to build a content/knowledge brand around founder, above observations might help.
